Field Detail

GAEDO_CONTEXT

public static final String GAEDO_CONTEXT
Ontologic context used by all gaedo graph elements.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GAEDO_HIDDEN_CONTEXT

public static final String GAEDO_HIDDEN_CONTEXT
Ontologic context used by gaedo graph elements that we want to keep hidden. Those elements should never be exported. To make sure this works well, this context is set to null. Crazy no ?

See Also:
Constant Field Values

CONTEXTS_MATCHER

public static final Pattern CONTEXTS_MATCHER
Compiled pattern used to match strings such as 
U https://github.com/Riduidel/gaedo/visible  U http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/description
or 
N U http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/description
or even 
N
You know why I do such a pattern matching ? Because sail graph named graph definintion goes by concatenaing contexts URI in edges properties. This is really douchebag code !

getEdgeNameFor

public static String getEdgeNameFor(Property p)
Generate edge name from property infos. Notice generated edge name will first be searched in property annotations, and only if none compatile found by generating a basic property name

Parameters:
p - source property
Returns:
an edge name (by default property container class name + "." + property name

Create a vertex out of a basic object. if object is of a simple type, we'll use value as id. Elsewhere, we will generate an id for object

Parameters:
database - database in which vertex will be stored
value -
Returns:

createInstance

public static Object createInstance(GraphDatabaseDriver driver,
                                    GraphMappingStrategy strategy,
                                    ClassLoader classLoader,
                                    com.tinkerpop.blueprints.pgm.Vertex key,
                                    Class<?> defaultType,
                                    ServiceRepository repository,
                                    Map<String,Object> objectsBeingAccessed)
Create an object instance from a literal vertex compatible with this service contained class

Parameters:
driver - driver used to load data
strategy - TODO
classLoader - class loader used to find class
key - vertex containing object id
repository - service repository, used to disambiguate subclass of literal and managed class
objectsBeingAccessed -
property - property used to navigate to this value. it allows disambiguation for literal values (which may be linked to more than one type, the typical example being a saved float, say "3.0", which may also be refered as the string "3.0").
Returns:
a fresh instance, with only id set

getIdOfLiteral

public static String getIdOfLiteral(Class<?> declaredClass,
                                    Property idProperty,
                                    Object objectId)
Get the value of the vertex id for the given literal

Parameters:
database - used graph
declaredClass - declared object class
idProperty - gives the declared type of id (which may differ from primitive types, where user may give an integer instead of a long, as an example). Notice that, contrary to most of gaedo code, this field can be null
objectId - object id value
Returns:
the value used by Properties#vertexId to identify the vertex associated to that object

value - object id value
Returns:
the value used by Properties#vertexId to identify the vertex associated to that object

getContextsOf

public static Collection<String> getContextsOf(com.tinkerpop.blueprints.pgm.Edge edge)
Find all contexts in given edge by looking, in GraphSail.CONTEXT_PROP property, what are the contexts. These contexts are extracted by iteratively calling CONTEXTS_MATCHER and Matcher.find(int) method.

Parameters:
edge - input edge
Returns:
collection of declared contexts.

isInNamedGraphs

public static boolean isInNamedGraphs(com.tinkerpop.blueprints.pgm.Edge e,
                                      Collection<String> namedGraphs)
Check if edge has the required named graphs list

Parameters:
e - edge to test
namedGraphs - named graphs the edge must have
Returns:
true if edge contexts are the given collection of named graphs
